articles.headline: Home Depot to Display an Environmental Label
articles.snippet: The new environmental initiative would become the largest green labeling program in American retailing.
articles.abstract: The new environmental initiative would become the largest green labeling program in American retailing.
articles.lead_paragraph: After squabbling over prices for decades, the nation’s big-box retail chains are ready to battle in a new arena: the environment.

articles.headline: Deal to Make Sallie Mae a Big Debtor
articles.snippet: The $25 billion buyout has the potential to not only transform Sallie Mae but shake up the entire lending industry.
articles.abstract: The $25 billion buyout has the potential to not only transform Sallie Mae but shake up the entire lending industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sallie Mae has long profited from making loans to college students. Now, the company will be saddling itself with debt in an effort to generate even more lucrative returns.

articles.headline: Managers Use Hedge Funds as Big I.R.A.’s
articles.snippet: Some hedge fund managers have discovered a way to avoid paying taxes on their huge fees for up to 10 years.
articles.abstract: Some hedge fund managers have discovered a way to avoid paying taxes on their huge fees for up to 10 years.
articles.lead_paragraph: Many Americans squirrel away as much as they can into retirement investment accounts like 401(k)s and I.R.A.’s that allow them to compound their earnings tax free. The accounts also reduce what they owe when tax day rolls around. For the average person, however, the government strictly limits the contributions to about $20,000 a year.

articles.headline: Housing Slump Takes a Toll on Illegal Immigrants
articles.snippet: Many immigrant workers who rode the construction boom now find few jobs on building sites.
articles.abstract: Many immigrant workers who rode the construction boom now find few jobs on building sites.
articles.lead_paragraph: HURON, Calif. — Some of the casualties of America’s housing bust are easy to spot up and down California’s Central Valley.

articles.headline: Shiite Cleric Has Six Quit Cabinet in Iraq Shake-Up
articles.snippet: It was the first time Moktada al-Sadr had followed through with a threat to cut some of his ties with the government.
articles.abstract: It was the first time Moktada al-Sadr had followed through with a threat to cut some of his ties with the government.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, April 16  Moktada al-Sadr, the rebellious Shiite cleric, withdrew his six ministers from the Iraqi cabinet on Monday, in the first major shake-up of Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki’s government since it was installed a year ago.

articles.headline: Amgen Seeks to Reverse Its Bad News
articles.snippet: A series of setbacks at the pharmaceutical giant pose the greatest challenge to its previously charmed 27-year history.
articles.abstract: A series of setbacks at the pharmaceutical giant pose the greatest challenge to its previously charmed 27-year history.

articles.headline: Fight Seen for ABN; Stock Soars
articles.snippet: The prospect of a bidding war for ABN Amro is making it difficult for the bank to seal a merger deal with its preferred partner, Barclays.
articles.abstract: The prospect of a bidding war for ABN Amro is making it difficult for the bank to seal a merger deal with its preferred partner, Barclays.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON, April 16  The prospect of a bidding war for ABN Amro sent its shares soaring on Monday, making it more difficult for the company, the biggest Dutch bank, to seal a merger deal with its preferred partner, Barclays, and reject an unusual overture from a group of three European banks.

articles.headline: Drumbeat of Shots, Broken by Pauses to Reload
articles.snippet: Students said the gunshots went on for what seemed like 10 or 20 minutes, an eternity with punctuation.
articles.abstract: Students said the gunshots went on for what seemed like 10 or 20 minutes, an eternity with punctuation.
articles.lead_paragraph: BLACKSBURG, Va., April 16 — The gunshots were so slow and steady that some students thought they came from a nearby construction site, until they saw the police officers with rifles pointed at Norris Hall, the engineering building at Virginia Tech.

articles.headline: Virginia Gunman Identified as a Student
articles.snippet: Federal officials today said that the gunman who killed 32 people and himself yesterday was Cho Seung-Hui, a student who lived in a dormitory on the Virginia Tech campus.
articles.abstract: Federal officials today said that the gunman who killed 32 people and himself yesterday was Cho Seung-Hui, a student who lived in a dormitory on the Virginia Tech campus.
articles.lead_paragraph: The gunman who killed 32 people and himself on the campus of Virginia Polytechnic Institute Monday was identified today as a student who lived in a dormitory on campus but kept to himself.

articles.headline: A Renewed Push for Ethanol, Without the Corn
articles.snippet: Pressure is building to sort out the myriad production problems preventing cellulosic ethanol from becoming a reality.
articles.abstract: Pressure is building to sort out the myriad production problems preventing cellulosic ethanol from becoming a reality.
articles.lead_paragraph: JENNINGS, La. — The sun shone brightly on the crowd gathered at the rusting old oil refinery here, as company officials showed off diagrams explaining how they planned to turn weeds and agricultural wastes into car fuel.
articles.byline: By Matthew L. Wald and Alexei Barrionuevo
